textBox.richText: Alright everyone, I am planning to take things …To The Next Level! I am going to purchase my very own domain name; it shall be awesome. I will be doing this through the awkwardly named GoDaddy site. The URL name I wish to use is (surprisingly) available too! You’d think by now practically every URL name would be taken or something, but no: that is wrong. The new URL name will also become the new name of my site. I owe credit to yet another suite mate for actually coming up with the new name. His name is Andrew. He is a bit rough around the edges, but he has a good heart somewhere on the inside. I apparently will be needing a MobileMe account to publish my site to my own domain via iWeb. Hopefully that won’t be too much of a problem though, seeing as we did get the MobileMe software when we bought our iMac for the household. Soon there will be no more tinyurl-ing, nor failness of the t35 hosting site I am trapped in! Because Facebook also feels it is necessary to BLOCK t35.com due to it “being reported as malicious by our friendly users.” That’s what gave rise to the tinyurl era of my URL. Cool Dude Richard had created the first one, tinyurl.com/KevinDoyleBlog, to one-up Facebook; which did work at the time, but now Facebook wised up and looked past the veil that was tinyurl. Every time I changed something on my site that consequently changed my site’s URL, the tinyurl I had became useless; and there is no way to get back ones that were already created. This is also why the current tinyurl is the obnoxiously long tinyurl.com/thelifeandtimesofkevin. So much to type. Kind of defeats the purpose of having a tinyurl. So, I will keep you guaiz updated on this whole shindig. I do hope I will be able to pull this off/go through with this. Only time will tell.
